result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Dent, Daren W
defendant.address: N2203 N. Merry Lane, Conrath, WI 54731

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daren W Dent in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard  along with 15CF5.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
15CF4-DRI.  DE will pay restitution in the amount of $220.00

15CF5- DE will enter a plea of Amended Ct 2, Ct 3. Ct's 1 and 4 will be DRI.  Ct 2- NC, Ct 3-NC, Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  
Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Court will order sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, concurrent, will serve 20 days jail on Ct 3, has 5 days credit, CC.   DE will not possess or consume alochol, no possession or consumption of illicit substances, cannot possess any substances that is mind altering,  no entry onto premises where alcohol is the primary business, any bars, taverns or liquor stores.  DE will be allowed huber, credit will apply to conditional jail time.  Atty asking that any personal property be returned, any money will apply to fines/court costs.
Defendant Daren W Dent in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF5.  Set for plea/sentencing 7/14/15 @ 2:00PM.

DE MUST NOT LEAVE RUSK COUNTY.  DO NOT POSSESS OR USE ILLEGAL SUBSTANCES.  DE MAY BE RELEASED FOR WORK PURPOSES TO MENOMONIE ONLY.  COURT WILL ALLOW TRAVEL OUT OF RUSK COUNTY TO SEE HIS MOTHER AND TO VISIT DAUGHTER.  CONCURRENT WITH 15CF5.

Defendant Daren W Dent in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF5.  Waive reading of information, enter plea's of NG.  Set for RH 6-16-15 @ 10:00AM.  DE would like to address the issue of travel on his bond, State has no objection to modifiying, will modify bond to allow travel out of Rusk County to visit his mother and to visit daughter.  All other conditions from previous bond will remain.  (first bond issued) concurrent

Defendant Daren W Dent in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF5.  DE will waive prelim hearings in each case.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim hearing, court will accept waiver.  Court will find probable cause,  will bind over for trial.  Set for 3-30-15 @ 2:30PM.
Preliminary hearing on March 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Daren W Dent in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF5.    Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaint.  Waive time limits for prelim hearing.  Court instructs on waiver of time limits for prelim hearing.  3-17-15 @ 1:00PM for prelim hearing.
